ui.splash
Class VoyagerSplash

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              javax.swing.JWindow
                  ui.splash.VoyagerSplash
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class VoyagerSplash
extends javax.swing.JWindow
implements java.lang.Runnable

A splash screen that produces the illusion of transparency for a top level Container. This splash screen also supports dynamic adding of a progress indicator (in the form of an animated GIF), and also dynamic text that is painted directly onto the splash screen. adapted from code by F. Fleischer

Author:
Andy Tzou
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

VoyagerSplash

public VoyagerSplash(java.lang.String splashFile)
Constructor for the SplashScreen object. The Splash Screen initially shows in "splash mode" that is bare-bones: no text (given in textToPaint) is not drawn, and the animated image (given in animatedFile) is also not drawn. Special methods later enable the text, animated image, and changes the splash image itself.

Parameters:
splashFile - file path of the splash image to display - this is required and painted at thread launch
Method Detail

setAnimated

public void setAnimated(java.lang.String animatedFile)
Designates an animated gif for splash screen that serves as a progress display. This method can be called at any time, and will instantly be displayed when invoked with a valid image file path. Note that the position of the animated image is controlled in the paint() method of VoyagerSplash.

Parameters:
animatedFile - file path to the animated image (usually gif)

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String newText)
Sets text for the splash screen. This method can be called at any time, and will instantly be displayed when invoked with a valid string. Note that the position of the text is controlled in the paint() method of VoyagerSplash.

Parameters:
newText - Text to render on splash screen

run

public void run()
Starts the initialization thread of the SplashScreen.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

close

public void close()
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Disposes of the SplashScreen. To be called shortly before the main application is ready to be displayed.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Is thrown if the initialization thread has not yet reached it's end.

Overrides the paint() method of JWindow.

g - The graphics context
